paragraphs.text:
%sh
hdfs dfs -put startup.csv
hdfs dfs -put consumerInternet.parquet
paragraphs.title: Putting files into HDFS

msg.data:
put: `startup.csv': File exists
put: `consumerInternet.parquet': File exists

paragraphs.title: Reading Data Files and Combining Them

msg.data:
root
 |-- Sr_No: string (nullable = true)
 |-- Date: string (nullable = true)
 |-- Startup_Name: string (nullable = true)
 |-- Industry_Vertical: string (nullable = true)
 |-- SubVertical: string (nullable = true)
 |-- City: string (nullable = true)
 |-- Investors_Name: string (nullable = true)
 |-- InvestmentnType: string (nullable = true)
 |-- Amount_in_USD: string (nullable = true)
 |-- Remarks: string (nullable = true)

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# Parquet files can also be used to create a temporary view and then used in SQL statements.
df3.createOrReplaceTempView("df3")

PuneStartups = spark.sql("SELECT COUNT(Startup_Name) FROM df3 WHERE City = 'Pune'")
PuneStartups.show()
paragraphs.title: How many startups are there in Pune City?

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

Startups = spark.sql("SELECT * FROM df3 LIMIT 20")
Startups.show()

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

Startups = spark.sql("SELECT COUNT(Startup_Name) FROM df3 WHERE InvestmentnType like 'Seed%/%' AND City = 'Pune'")
Startups.show()
paragraphs.title: How many startups in Pune got their Seed/ Angel Funding?

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

PuneCityAmount = spark.sql("SELECT SUM(regexp_replace(Amount_in_USD, 'N/A', '00')) AS Amount FROM df3 WHERE City = 'Pune'")
PuneCityAmount.show()
paragraphs.title: What is the total amount raised by startups in PuneCity? Hint - use regex_replace to get rid of null

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

#Industry_Vertical

TopFive = spark.sql("SELECT Industry_Vertical, COUNT(Startup_Name) FROM df3 GROUP BY Industry_Vertical ORDER BY COUNT(Startup_Name) DESC LIMIT 5")
TopFive.show()
paragraphs.title: What are the top 5 Industry_Vertical which has the highest number of startups in India?

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# Investors_Name
# Date  09/01/2020

#TopInvestor = spark.sql("SELECT EXTRACT(YEAR FROM TO_DATE(Date,'DD/MM/YYYY') AS Date, Investors_Name FROM df3")
#TopInvestor.show()
paragraphs.title: Find the top Investor(by amount) of each year.
